The Convention for the Popular Revolution insurgency is an ongoing conflict waged by the Convention for the Popular Revolution (CPR) in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), primarily in the Ituri province. The group's armed wing is technically called the Forces for the Popular Revolution (FRP). The insurgency began in 2025, and has already resulted in numerous deaths and displacement.
Background
Timeline
Around 16 August, FARDC confirmed that CPR had attempted numerous attack within the week. It reported that the army had successfully killed 12 CPR militants in two different locations about 30km north of Bunia.
